mainEntity.name: What is Telegram and where can I find more information about it?

acceptedAnswer.text: Telegram is a cloud-based messaging platform known for its focus on privacy and speed. More information can be found on their official website: [Telegram's Official Website](https://telegram.org/).

mainEntity.name: What does GDPR stand for and what does it cover?

acceptedAnswer.text: GDPR stands for General Data Protection Regulation. It is a law implemented by the European Union to protect the privacy and personal data of individuals within the EU. Detailed information can be accessed through the European Commission's page: [GDPR Information](https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-topic/data-protection/eu-data-protection-rules_en).

mainEntity.name: What is CCPA and how does it impact privacy rights?

acceptedAnswer.text: CCPA stands for California Consumer Privacy Act. It provides California residents with rights regarding their personal information, including the right to know, delete, and opt-out of the sale of their personal data. More details are available on the California Government's website: [CCPA Overview by California Government](https://oag.ca.gov/privacy/ccpa).

mainEntity.name: Where can I learn more about WhatsApp's security and privacy measures?

acceptedAnswer.text: WhatsApp offers information on their encryption methods and privacy policies on their Security page: [WhatsApp's Security and Privacy Page](https://www.whatsapp.com/security/).

mainEntity.name: What privacy features does Signal offer?

acceptedAnswer.text: Signal provides several privacy features, including end-to-end encryption and self-destructing messages. Further information on these features can be found at: [Signal's Privacy Features](https://signal.org/en/).
